Short Description: Concerns about fairness in land compensation.
Description: Issues regarding delays or unfair compensation for private lands acquired for public projects.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What specific challenges have you faced with land compensation?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the size of the land affected (in sq. meters or hectares)?"

Short Description: Issues shifting utilities like power lines or networks.
Description: Challenges in restoring access to electricity due to project disruption.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "How long has the electricity access been disrupted?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many households or businesses are impacted by the outage?"

Short Description: Issues shifting water pipes.
Description: Disruptions caused by water pipe relocations, leading to water shortages.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "How long has the water access been disrupted?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many people or households lack water access?"

Short Description: Need for safe animal crossings across roads.
Description: Requests to construct underpasses or bridges for wildlife movement, preventing accidents and habitat fragmentation.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Which species are most affected by the absence of crossings?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many wildlife accidents have occurred?"

Short Description: Destruction of natural wildlife habitat.
Description: Complete destruction of wildlife habitats by project activities, endangering species.
Follow-Up Question - Description:
"Which wildlife habitats have been affected?"
"Which endangered species have been affected?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the estimated size of the habitat destroyed (in sq. meters)?"

Short Description: Complaints about air pollution due to construction.
Description: Airborne dust and emissions from machinery and vehicles affecting nearby areas.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "How does it affect the health of your relatives?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification:
"How many people are affected, can you list them?"
"Can you assess the gravity of their illness on a scale from 1 to 5?"

Short Description: Complaints about noise due to construction.
Description: Noise from heavy machinery and vehicular traffic disrupting local communities.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What time periods are worst for noise pollution?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many hours per day are noise levels intolerable?"

Short Description: Requests for jobs for locals during projects.
Description: Frustrations over limited or inequitable job opportunities for local populations despite project benefits.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Have you or others applied for jobs? What was the outcome?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many people have been affected by lack of employment opportunities?"

Short Description: Impacts on cultural or religious sites.
Description: Damage or disrespect to cultural monuments or religious shrines during construction.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Which cultural or religious sites have been affected?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many cultural events or practices have been impacted?"

Short Description: Safety concerns specific to women.
Description: Fear of harassment or lack of safe infrastructure for women in construction zones.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Have specific incidents or risks been identified, can you list them?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many events have been reported to you?"

Short Description: Forced relocation problems.
Description: Inadequate resettlement provisions, cultural reasons for rejection, or poor housing and infrastructure.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What specific issues have you encountered with relocation?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many individuals or families have been displaced?"

Short Description: Poor water management causing non-farm damage.
Description: Construction blockages causing flooding, waterlogging, or sanitation hazards.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What areas are affected by flooding or waterlogging?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the estimated damage area (in sq. meters or hectares)?"

Short Description: Pedestrian safety demands.
Description: Lack of crosswalks or underpasses, leading to unsafe conditions in high-traffic zones.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Which areas lack safety provisions for pedestrians?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many accidents or near misses have occurred?"

Short Description: Chemical spills or waste contaminating farmland.
Description: Contamination from construction materials or fuel degrading soil productivity.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What types of contaminants have been observed?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the size of the affected farmland (in hectares)?"

Short Description: Loss of soil fertility or damage.
Description: Soil compaction, erosion, or sediment deposition on farmlands caused by project activities.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What specific damage has occurred to the soil?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How much farmland has been rendered unusable (in hectares)?"

Short Description: Concerns about deforestation.
Description: Felling of trees for construction affecting ecosystems and local livelihoods.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What types of trees have been cut, and why?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How many trees have been felled in total?"

Short Description: Damage to crops by construction or trespassing.
Description: Loss of agricultural produce from dust, debris, or encroachment by project vehicles.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Which crops have been affected, and how?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the total loss in yield (in kg or tons)?"

Short Description: Stolen crops or livestock.
Description: Reports of theft of harvested or unharvested crops, or livestock.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What type of crops or livestock were stolen?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the estimated value of the stolen crops or livestock (in currency)?"

Short Description: Stolen farming or personal tools.
Description: Loss of implements allegedly taken by workers or others in project zones.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What specific tools or equipment were stolen?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the estimated value of the stolen tools (in currency)?"

Short Description: Accidental or intentional fires.
Description: Fires caused by mishandling of flammables or negligence, damaging property or resources.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "What caused the fire, and what property was affected?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What is the total area or value of damage caused by the fire?"

Generic Grievance Name: Poor housing quality of the resettlement site
Short Description: Poor housing quality of the resettlement site
Description: Lack of adequate resettlement, compensation, or alternative housing for those displaced by the project.
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Can you describe your housing and its condition?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How would you rate your new house compare to what you were promised from 1 to 5, 1 being the worse and 5 what you expected?"

Generic Grievance Name: Lack of infrastructure of the resettlement site
Short Description: Lack of infrastructure of the resettlement site
Description: Lack of road, electricity, water, access to public transport at the resettlement site
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Can you describe the issues you face because of the lack of infrastructure?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "What are the lacking infrastructures?"

Generic Grievance Name: Poor location of the resettlement site
Short Description: Poor location of the resettlement site
Description: Distance to village from the resettlement site and lack of job opportunities or access to school
Follow-Up Question - Description: "Can you describe the issues you face because of the location?"
Follow-Up Question - Quantification: "How long does it take to go to your farm site or village or school?"
